name: OFFICE OF DISCIPLINARY COUNSEL, Petitioner, v. David A. JONES, Respondent
name_abbreviation: Office of Disciplinary Counsel v. Jones

parties: OFFICE OF DISCIPLINARY COUNSEL, Petitioner, v. David A. JONES, Respondent.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
AND NOW, this 18th day of June, 1993, an Order and Rule to Show Cause having been entered by this Court on March 24,1993, upon consideration of the responses filed, it is hereby ORDERED that:
1. The Rule is made absolute and respondent is placed on temporary suspension until further definitive action by this Court;
2. Respondent shall comply with the provisions of Rule 217, Pa.R.D.E.;
3. The President Judge of the Court of Common Pleas of Allegheny County, in accordance with Rule 217(g), Pa.R.D.E., shall take such further action and make such further orders as may be necessary to protect fully the rights and interests of respondent’s clients.
This Order constitutes an imposition of public discipline within the meaning of Rule 402, Pa.R.D.E., pertaining to confidentiality.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

casebody.head_matter:
627 A.2d 1175
OFFICE OF DISCIPLINARY COUNSEL, Petitioner, v. David A. JONES, Respondent.
No. 925 Disciplinary Docket No. 2.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
June 18, 1993.
